meanings.definition: A place where films are shown.
meanings.sent1: The cinematheque in town has a big screen for movies.
meanings.sent2: Let's go to the cinematheque this weekend to watch a new film.
meanings.sent3: I got lost and accidentally ended up in the cinematheque instead of the library.
meanings.sent4: Her living room transformed into a cozy cinematheque with a projector and popcorn.
meanings.sent5: The cinematheque was filled with the flickering light of the projector, creating a magical atmosphere.

meanings.sent1: The cinematheque houses a collection of rare films from the 1920s.
meanings.sent2: Visitors can explore the cinematheque to learn about the history of cinema.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat snuck into the cinematheque and caused chaos among the film reels.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a cinematheque of memories, each film playing vividly in her thoughts.
meanings.sent5: Walking through the cinematheque felt like stepping into a time capsule of cinematic treasures.

meanings.definition: A cinema specializing in the showing of classic or art films.
meanings.sent1: The cinematheque downtown always screens old black-and-white movies.
meanings.sent2: Film enthusiasts gather at the cinematheque to enjoy rare art films.
meanings.sent3: The popcorn at the cinematheque tasted like buttery nostalgia.
meanings.sent4: His eyes were like projectors, illuminating the world around him like a cinematheque.
meanings.sent5: The cinematheque was a sanctuary for those seeking the beauty of classic cinema.
